name: Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choiced this Hilton Hotel because we wanted to have a stay at the seaside.
reviews.title: Nice room with sea-view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a nice clean room with balcony - we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great Get Away Spot

reviews.text: Continental breakfast (hilton gold) was good.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.text: Parking was expensive.
reviews.title: Great SD Airport Hotel
Amazing Rooms Amazing Service
reviews.text: On our trips we always stay in hotels of the HiltonFamily. I think the hotel is average and in some hotels the staff is more friendly, But beeing there for one night was ok.

The hotel is conveniently located just 5 minutes from the airport. All summer long a $3 per person per day shuttle runs downtown and to other attractions. Bike rentals are just a quick walk down Harbor Island. The hotel itself is clean, quiet and the staff were all very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: San Diego Airport Hilton - a wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Had a one night stopover on the way to Honolulu. Airport shuttle is very convenient and just a few minutes from the airport to the hotel. I was upgraded to an executive room that was spacious, comfortable and with the most magnificent views of San Diego bay and Coronado. A few really nice restaurants in walking distance, and an easy ride to the airport for my onward flight. A well run establishment with friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The additional, daily parking charge is ridiculous. Anymore, parking and wi-fi internet service, and local calls should be included in the daily room price. At lower-end hotels, this is included in the rooms rate. At almost $200 p/night, these basic items should not be a la carte.
reviews.title: Hilton San Diego, off the marina

reviews.text: Live in Carlsbad, but have sailing friends in Shelter/Harbor Island so I frequent hotels on weekends. Been to this one about 6 times. Higher floors better view, but can be fine on even 2nd floor. One of the three elevators very erratic, comes to the floor and leaves without opening doors, can lead to waits. Weird they recently did remodeling of rooms, but left elevators 1980's with burned out bulbs. Last time was given room someone was obviously smoking in, but got that corrected. Can walk along bay, but really need car to get anywhere. They ought to rent bikes. $21 charge for parking, and all too often the gate doesn't read card right, or desk doesn't program it right and you find yourself pounding the call button for minutes. If that happens, go back to desk, get them to redo it, and "ask" for discount. Plane noise never a problem. Have never gotten room service, nor been to restaurant so don't know about them. Wifi always been fine for me. Pet peeve having staircases only exiting to ground floor with big "emergency use only" signs on them. Use them to exit if on lower floors.
reviews.title: Nice location if have car

reviews.text: Stayed here one night before flying home. Recently has been renovated. Looks good. Sleek. Modern. Room was good size. Very comfortable. Lots of desktop outlets. There was an outlet every where. Very convenient. Desk staff were personable. Room service was good. Generally quiet. Great views of the harbor. In fact the walking path along the harbor is a great built in feature.
reviews.title: Good nights sleep before the flight out...

reviews.text: Very nice rooom. Great view of harbor and city. The room had every thing except a refrigerator. I would think that a Hilton would have every thing that other hotels include in the price. Had to pay for parking. Be sure to ckeck on every before booking. But all in all very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Harbor island San Diego ca.

reviews.text: The service is good, the rooms are clean, modern and comfortable, the beds are nice and it has some great views from the balconies. But, as a BUSINESS TRAVELER, this hotel doesn't measure up for 1 main reason: Internet/WIFI access in room. While WIFI is available and was free in my room, it was slow, often spotty, and didn't support VPN connections. In fact, the whole process of signing in to use the Internet was sloppy and seemed amateur like, with the button to proceed after giving your last name and room number doesn't even let you know it's working. It takes about 2 minutes while you wait and are unsure whether its doing anything.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not for a business traveler

reviews.text: Look, this is a hotel by the airport and charges over $200/night and this is unacceptable for a presumed business class hotel! Nearly all business travelers use Internet/WIFI connections now--get current Hilton because this is almost as lame as having to wait 5 seconds every time you change the channel on your TV (another thing lame about this hotel).
reviews.title: Good overnight stop

reviews.text: Got a deal on Priceline/Hotwire so it made this more affordable for a 1 night stopover before hitting the airport early. Easy access to the airport and rental car returns. Nice harbor side walkway if you need to stretch your legs. We had a great harbor view and could see all of san diego downtown. Staff friendly but note that parking is (i think) $17 a night so be aware of that. We knew before hand but all the hotels there charge and we just considered it part of the night price. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. One elevator was out while we were there but such is life with maintaining those.
reviews.title: Decent hotel close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night as we had a really early flight out of San Diego Airport. My brother is Hiltonhonors so he took care of it. Not sure how much the rooms cost. If your room faces the bay then the view is awesome. If your room faces the airport then you get a view of the rooftop next door which is dirty and nasty. The front lady was awesome and got us breakfast in advance, wake-up call and other business stuff for him. The restaurant is OK, nothing spectacular and it is a bit pricey.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were routed from St Croix thru Miami thru San Diego to get to Portland Or and needed to sleep someplace. I have Hilton Honors so we stayed at this hotel. It was clean. It was a short night. We had little interaction with the place at all.
reviews.title: jAmerican Airlines doesn;t give a damn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about their surrounding areas. Great location for good views of sunset. Would recommend hotel to friends and family. Rooms and restroom were clean and up to date and very spacious.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel are extremely helpful and nice, the rooms were clean and the view was amazing. We loved the balcony where we could see the ships passing. I wish the conference I was attending was held there instead of another hotel, so we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
This hotel rocks!
reviews.text: I had checked out of the hospital and went straight to the hotel. The staff was amazing and helpful, the room was so comfortable, the room service was quick and the food fresh and tasty, and the airport shuttle helped us to the airport and tracked down our wheel chairs! I would stay here anytime I am in San Diego!

Hilton personnel display incredible customer service...every single worker was so kind and accomodating. Tha Bad thing is that the elevators a bit out dated and the worst thing is that all the guest room doors will slam with great ferocity if not slowed down physically...all you hear is room shaking door slamming down the hall, above, below, and next door to your room...very irritating!
reviews.title: Hilton Harbor Island

aka: Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island Hotel
description: The Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island hotel in San Diego, CA is located just minutes away from the exciting adventures and beautiful landscapes that San Diego has to offer. Boasting incredible views of the harbor and marina, the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island sets the tone for any trip, whether you are traveling for business or leisure. Lounge at the pool, host your next meeting in our stylish boardroom, or simply relax in your spacious guest room or suite, complete with luxurious bedding and bath amenities and a delicious room service menu. Enjoy our complimentary airport shuttle, and FREE in-room high-speed wifi Internet access. Here at the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island hotel, the only thing we overlook is the harbor, and we look forward to welcoming you as our guest soon.
